intro.description: This tests for the creation of a criteria based scope

item.title: Open the help Browser
item.description:
Help/Help Contents.
Verify that the help contents opens.

item.title: Define a scope with criteria
item.description: Create a scope which filters based on criteria

subitem.label: Click on the scope link next to the search typein, a dialog called "Select Scope" should open.
In the select scope dialog press "New...". A dialog named New Scope should be opened
Verify that to the right of the topics there is a list of criteria and that none of them is checked
Verify that the following criteria are displayed: Title contains the letter, platform, version
Expand Title contains the letter. Verify that there are five checkboxes underneath it: letter c, letter k, letter t, letter v and uncategorized.
Check letter v, and press OK, verify that a dialog shows saying "You must select at least one topic"
Check the checkbox for each of the topics on the left of the dialog

item.title: Check the scope
item.description: From the select scope dialog hit Edit and verify that letter v is the only criterion selected. Hit OK to dismiss the Edit scope dialog.

item.title: Apply the new scope
item.description: Hit OK to get out of the Select Scope Dialog. The table of contents view should be redrawn with less books included. Check that every book displayed contains the letter 'v'

item.title: Expand the books
item.description: Expand each of the books in the toc. Verify that each book displayed expands correctly and that every subtopic contains a letter 'v' in the title.
